[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: deal()] [Cryptographic bypass] Can a malicious dealer craft a transcript where the Shamir polynomial's constant term differs from the claimed secret, allowing them to deal a different secret than advertised while still passing verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: deal()] [Polynomial manipulation] Does the FFT-based polynomial evaluation properly handle threshold-1 degree polynomials, or can an attacker use a higher-degree polynomial to compromise threshold security guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: deal()] [Integer overflow] In the polynomial coefficient generation, can the threshold parameter cause integer overflow when computing t-1 coefficients, leading to incorrect secret sharing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: deal()] [Truncation error] After FFT evaluation is truncated to n shares, are there edge cases where sc.n equals sc.domain.size() that could cause incorrect share distribution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: encrypt_chunked_shares()] [Randomness correlation] Does the correlated_randomness generation properly ensure that sum of r_j * B^j equals zero, or can weak randomness correlation leak information about the shared secret? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: encrypt_chunked_shares()] [Range proof bypass] Can an attacker craft chunks outside the valid range [0, 2^ell) but still produce a valid range proof commitment, breaking the discrete log security assumption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: encrypt_chunked_shares()] [Proof malleability] Is the HKZG commitment binding enough to prevent an attacker from creating two different witnesses that map to the same commitment, allowing proof malleability attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: encrypt_chunked_shares()] [Homomorphism collision] Can two different plaintext/randomness combinations produce identical chunked ciphertexts, allowing an attacker to claim they dealt a different secret than they actually did? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Struct: UnsignedTranscript] [Signature bypass] Does the BCS serialization of UnsignedTranscript include all security-critical fields, or can an attacker modify sharing_proof after signature generation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: verify()] [Signature verification] Is the signature verification checked before any expensive cryptographic operations, or can an attacker cause computational DoS by providing invalid signatures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: verify()] [Array bounds] Can mismatched encryption key counts cause out-of-bounds array access when verifying PoK with eks_inner, leading to panics or undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: verify()] [PoK verification bypass] In the sigma protocol PoK verification, can an attacker manipulate the Fiat-Shamir challenge by controlling session_id or dealer.id to bypass proof verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: verify()] [Range proof batch] Does the batched range proof verification properly check all n*num_chunks values, or can an attacker craft a proof where only a subset is verified? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: verify()] [LDT soundness] Can the SCRAPE Low Degree Test be bypassed by carefully crafting polynomial evaluations that pass the random linear combination test but don't represent a low-degree polynomial? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: verify()] [MSM manipulation] In the final multi-scalar multiplication verification, can an attacker exploit the random beta sampling to find colliding weighted combinations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: verify()] [Pairing equation] Is the zero-pairing check e(weighted_Cs, H) = e(G, weighted_Vs) sound, or can an attacker craft values that satisfy the pairing without correctly encrypting shares? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: verify()] [Beta sampling] Is the random beta used in weighted verification truly unpredictable, or can an attacker who sees multiple verifications learn information about the dealt secret? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: verify()] [Session ID collision] Can two different DKG sessions with colliding session_ids cause verification to accept invalid transcripts from one session in another? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: decrypt_own_share()] [Decryption key mismatch] If a player uses wrong decryption key dk, will BSGS dlog fail gracefully or can it return incorrect share values that appear valid? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: decrypt_own_share()] [BSGS table] Can an attacker craft ciphertexts that cause BSGS discrete log to fail for honest players, preventing them from recovering their shares? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: decrypt_own_share()] [Chunk reconstruction] After recovering chunks via BSGS, can integer overflow occur when reconstructing the full scalar from le_chunks_to_scalar? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: decrypt_own_share()] [Ephemeral key] Does multiplying each R_i by dk properly compute the shared secret, or can malformed R values cause incorrect decryption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Aggregation soundness] When aggregating SubTranscripts, can mismatched player counts or chunk counts cause incorrect aggregation that breaks threshold security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Index bounds] Are the loops over sc.n and Cs[i].len() bounds-checked to prevent out-of-bounds access during aggregation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Group operation] Do the elliptic curve point additions (self.Vs[i] += other.Vs[i]) handle point at infinity correctly, avoiding identity element issues? (Medium)
